fluency.name: Fluency Exercises
fluency.description: Exercises focused on rhythm, pacing, and smooth speech flow

fluency.title: Controlled Rate Reading
fluency.instructions: I'm going to give you a short sentence. Please repeat it back to me slowly and clearly, focusing on maintaining an even pace throughout. Take your time.
fluency.content: The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.
coaching_prompts: Take a breath before you start
Focus on saying each word clearly
Don't rush - maintain steady pacing
Great job! Let's try it one more time

fluency.title: Phrase Repetition with Rhythm
fluency.instructions: I'll say a phrase with a specific rhythm pattern. Listen carefully, then repeat it back matching my rhythm and pace.
coaching_prompts: Listen to the pauses I make
Match my rhythm exactly
Good! Now try to make it flow more smoothly
Excellent rhythm control

word_recall.title: Category Naming - Animals
word_recall.instructions: I want you to name as many animals as you can think of. Take your time, and say each animal clearly. Ready?
coaching_prompts: Take your time thinking
Speak clearly for each animal
Great! Can you think of any more?
Excellent word finding!

word_recall.title: Semantic Fluency - Kitchen Items
word_recall.instructions: Name things you would find in a kitchen. Try to think of at least 8 items. Speak each one clearly.
coaching_prompts: Think about different areas of the kitchen
What do you use for cooking?
Don't forget about appliances
You're doing great with word finding

pronunciation.title: Consonant Practice - P, B, T, D
pronunciation.instructions: We're going to practice clear consonant sounds. I'll give you word pairs. Repeat each word clearly, making sure the beginning sounds are distinct.
coaching_prompts: Make sure your lips come together firmly for P and B
Feel your tongue touch the roof of your mouth for T and D
Great distinction between those sounds!
Your articulation is improving

pronunciation.title: Vowel Clarity Practice
pronunciation.instructions: Let's work on clear vowel sounds. I'll give you word pairs that differ only in the vowel sound. Repeat each pair, making the vowel sounds very distinct.
coaching_prompts: Open your mouth more for the first vowel
Feel the difference in your tongue position
Excellent vowel distinction!
Your vowel clarity is really improving

beginner.description: Simple, short exercises with clear instructions
